title: Music-KG-Project
description: The Music-KG-Project is a comprehensive initiative that constructs a knowledge graph centered on music sampling relationships. It involves data extraction, processing, and visualization to map out how various music pieces are interconnected through sampling. The project utilizes Neo4j for database management and Streamlit for creating interactive web applications, providing an insightful tool for exploring the intricate web of music samples.

title: CascaProject
description: The Casca Project automates the evaluation of loan eligibility by processing financial documents, such as bank statements, through a workflow that converts PDFs into images and analyzes them using OpenAI's GPT-4 model. This approach streamlines the assessment process, offering a more efficient method for financial document analysis.

title: SetupForge
description: SetupForge is a Windows desktop application developed in C++ using wxWidgets, designed to automate software installation and system configuration tasks. It enables users to create and execute custom installation scripts for operations like running executables, managing files and directories, setting environment variables, editing the registry, and mapping network drives.

title: cs566-project
description: OneNet is a channel-wise 1D convolutional U-Net designed for efficient and accurate segmentation of one-dimensional data. This project includes the official implementation of the model, along with comprehensive documentation and resources for training and evaluation.

title: E-DataSync-Distributed-E-Commerce-Inventory-Management
description: E-DataSync is a distributed e-commerce inventory management system designed to efficiently handle inventory data across multiple locations. The project encompasses backend database management, frontend user interfaces, and various application pages to provide a comprehensive solution for inventory tracking and synchronization.

title: pe-consensus-scoring
description: The "PE Consensus and Scoring" project implements algorithms for consensus and scoring, deployed on AWS Lambda to process messages related to consensus requests and article publishing.

title: software-dev
description: The "software-dev" repository contains prototype files developed by the Public Editor Software Development Team. It includes various components such as web scrapers, Chrome extensions, visualization tools, and mobile applications, showcasing a range of development projects.

title: 2022-wi-stats21
description: The "2022-wi-stats21" repository contains instructional materials for an introductory data science course, including lectures on Git basics, Jupyter Notebook usage, and fundamental data types.

title: CalHackss
description: The CalHackss repository contains a partial codebase from a project developed during the CalHacks hackathon. Due to GitHub's 50MB storage limit, the complete code isn't uploaded. The repository includes various files and directories, such as `app.py`, `my_script.py`, and a `reflex_app` folder, indicating components of a Python-based application. However, without additional context or documentation, it's challenging to provide a detailed description of the project's functionality.

title: chrisapton.github.io
description: This repository contains the source code for my personal website, which showcases my portfolio and professional information.

title: Coding_Assessment_2024
description: The "Applicant Compatibility Scoring System" is a Python script that evaluates candidates for a technical team by calculating compatibility scores based on attributes such as intelligence, strength, endurance, and tolerance for spicy food. It utilizes NumPy and pandas for data processing and requires an input JSON file named `input.json` to function.

title: Heart-Disease-Prediction
description: The Heart Disease Prediction project involves analyzing heart disease datasets using R to develop predictive models. It includes R Markdown files, datasets for training and testing, and a comprehensive report detailing the methodology and findings.

title: MITHacks
description: Enlighten Me is a web application that facilitates real-time debates on controversial topics. Built with a Python Flask backend and a frontend utilizing HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React, the platform presents users with a "Change My Mind" image featuring a contentious statement. Participants engage in a five-minute discussion before the topic refreshes, encouraging dynamic and continuous conversations.

title: projects
description: The GitHub repository at [https://github.com/chrisapton/projects](https://github.com/chrisapton/projects) contains two files: `README.md` and `hello.txt`. The `README.md` file is typically used to provide an overview or documentation for the repository, while `hello.txt` may contain sample text or serve as a placeholder. However, without additional context or content in these files, it's challenging to provide a detailed description of the project's functionality.

title: round_robin
description: The "Encore Round Robin Website" repository contains the source code for the website [roundrobinstore.com](https://roundrobinstore.com), including HTML, CSS, and image files.

title: STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023
description: The "STATS-199-Research-SPR-2023" repository contains materials from a data science research project, including Jupyter Notebooks, a final project report, and code documentation.
